{"step_by_step_thinking": "Von Willebrand factor (VWF) is a blood glycoprotein involved in hemostasis. It is not produced by neutrophils or monocytes, which are types of white blood cells involved in immune response. Platelets do store VWF, but they do not produce it. The primary cells that produce VWF are endothelial cells, which line the interior surface of blood vessels.", "answer_choice": "B. Endothelial cells"}
